subject: DIS
name: Beginning Danish I
info: Speaking/understanding skills for everyday situations, using family or collegium as point of departure. Reading, writing,  grammar.

subject: DIS
name: Beginning Danish II
info: Speaking/understanding skills for everyday situations. Using family or collegium as point of departure. Reading, writing, grammar.

subject: DIS
name: Intermediate Danish I
info: First semester of second-year Danish, using increasingly difficult texts and written assignments.

subject: DIS
name: Intermediate Danish II
info: Continues intermediate Danish I at more advanced level.

subject: DIS
name: DIS course
info: Study abroad course.

subject: DIS
name: DIS course
info: Study abroad course.

subject: DIS
name: DIS course
info: Study abroad course.

subject: DIS
name: DIS course
info: Study abroad course.

subject: DIS
name: DIS course
info: Study abroad course.

subject: DIS
name: DHA: Interior Design Studio
info: Research/design. Aspects of Danish tradition, its relation to surrounding culture.

subject: DIS
name: ArtH: Euro Art of 19th Cent
fullname: European Art of the 19th Century: From Classicism to Symbolism
info: Development of art in 19th century in France and Scandinavian countries.

subject: DIS
name: ArtH: Euro Art of 20th Cent
fullname: European Art of the 20th Century: From Expressionism to Postwar Art
info: Major artistic concepts, 1900-1950. Expressionism, cubism, abstract art, surrealism.

subject: DIS
name: ArtH:Euro Art:Impres - Abstrct
fullname: European Art: From Impressionism to Abstract Art
info: Modernist art of late 19th and early 20th centuries.

subject: DIS
name: ArtH: History of European Film
info: Emphasizes post-World War II film history of France, Italy, Germany, Great Britain, the Soviet Union, and Scandinavia. Basic facts/methods of film comprehension, film analysis, and general film history.

subject: DIS
name: ArtH: Contemporary Euro Film
fullname: Contemporary European Film: the Individual and Society
info: Representative themes in contemporary European film concerning attitudes in social, political, and artistic issues in France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, Sweden, and other countries.

subject: DIS
name: Dnce: History, European Ballet
info: Main facets of European ballet from Renaissance to present, its development in social/artistic context. Visits to Royal Danish Ballet.

subject: DIS
name: EngL: Dickens and Andersen
fullname: Dickens and Andersen: Romanticism, Realism, and Modernism
info: Comparative reading of Dickens and Andersen. Touches on European literary romanticism, realism, and modernism.

subject: DIS
name: EngL: Hans Christian Andersen
info: Life/works of Andersen. Analysis of selected texts. Andersen as writer in European romantic tradition.

subject: DIS
name: EngL:Masterpieces:Mod Scan Lit
info: Introduction to major figures in Scandinavian literature since 1870.  "Modern breakthrough." Literature as vehicle raising social/human problems and as expression of Scandinavian character and world view.

subject: DIS
name: GloS:Nationalsm/Minorty in Eur
info: Causes/impacts of nationalism. Proliferation of ethnic/national minority conflict in post-Cold War Europe. Models to explain nationalism. Instruments/policies to deal with nationalism.

subject: DIS
name: GloS:Euro Environ Prob, Policy
fullname: Environmental Problems and Policy: a European Perspective
info: Current local/global environmental issues, options at hand, politics involved.

subject: DIS
name: GloS:Euro Conflict & Security
info: Problems of European security. Emphasizes issues resulting from end of Cold War. Search for new European security order. Emergence of security threats such as nationalism and minority issues.

subject: DIS
name: GloS:Russia under Putin
info: Past/current developments. Attempts to look into future: How will Russia develop politically, economically, and militarily?

subject: DIS
name: Hist:Euro Jews:Mid Age,Present
fullname: The Jews in Europe from the Middle Ages to the Present
info: History, culture, and beliefs of the Jewish populations in Eastern and Western Europe, mostly from 18th century to present.

subject: DIS
name: Hist:Impact: Disease in Europe
fullname: The Impact of Epidemic Disease upon European History
info: How epidemic disease has been a powerful factor in shaping attitudes, belief systems, institutions, and policies (e.g., public health).

subject: DIS
name: Hist:Environ History of Europe
info: European history, Ice Age-present, from ecological perspective. Theories of environment as determining factor in historical development.

subject: DIS
name: Hist:20th Century Europe
info: Main periods/trends in European history, from end of 19th century to present. Interplay of political, social, and ideological developments.

subject: DIS
name: Hist:America in Euro Mirror
info: Relations between America and Europe over last three centuries. How Europeans used interpretations of American society/culture to create/confirm their own identity.

subject: DIS
name: Phil:Kierkegaard:Meaning Life
fullname: Kierkegaard: Philosophy and the Meaning of Life
info: Kierkegaard?s view on relationship of personal existence to art, society, philosophy, and religion.

subject: DIS
name: Phil: Making of Modern Self
info: Introduction to Kant, Hegel, Nietzche, Heidegger, and others. Trying to find meaning in a world that no longer offers one answer to the question, "What is a human being?"

subject: DIS
name: Phil: Biomedical Ethics
info: What are ethical criteria for evaluating biotechnology? How far do we want to legislate "life"? How can such legislation be enforced?

subject: DIS
name: Pol: Danish Politics& Society
info: Analyzes politics, economics, and society of contemporary Denmark.

subject: DIS
name: Pol:Western European Politics
fullname: Western European Politics: Western European Politics
info: Transformation of Europe as it becomes a major player in the world scene. Internal balance between unifying countries and rise of local identities.

subject: DIS
name: Pol:The European Union
info: European unification, from its inception in early 1990s to its ongoing development today.

subject: DIS
name: Psy:Brain & Experience of Self
fullname: Brain Functioning and the Experience of Self
info: Relationship between biological, psychological, and social factors that contribute to human functioning and the individual?s experience of self-in-the-world.

subject: DIS
name: Psy:Devlopment Psychopathology
info: Risk, resilience, and psychopathology in children?s development. Bridges gap between developmental psychology and abnormal psychology.

subject: DIS
name: Scan:Nordic Mythology
info: Myths, cults, and traditions of pre-Christian Nordic peoples as expressed in contemporary literature, eye-witness reports, and art. Emphasizes Viking period. All readings in modern English translations.

subject: DIS
name: Soc: Criminal Justice in Scand
info: Ideology of crime control and criminal justice administration in Scandinavia, with a North American point of reference. Emphasizes Scandinavia's liberal criminal policy and fairly modest crime rate.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Arch Foundations Studio
info: Elements of architectural design: principles of structure, process of design, composition of form, functional resolution, language of architectural graphics, presentation of projects in drawings/models.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Arch Design Studio
info: Combines small-group/individual research, programming, and design in relation to Danish regional conditions. Field visits (e.g., buildings, housing areas, construction sites).

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Interior Design Studio
info: Builds on Architectural Design Studio I, with increasing independence in programming/evaluating projects.

subject: DIS
name: Arch:20th Century Danish Arch
info: Danish architecture in historical, political, and social/architectural context. Relation of Danish architecture to Scandinavian/international architecture.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Contemp Euro Arch Theory
info: Complexities of contemporary architecture. Comprehensive foundation for students? own work.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Watercolor Painting
info: Watercolor painting theory/practice. Wet/dry painting techniques. Mixing/applying colors. Choosing tools/paper. Effects of color pigment/shading. Meaning of shape/volume, light/shadow, glossy/matte, and short/long viewing distance.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Visual Journal
info: Seminar. Students develop Journal as tool for analyzing (e.g., architectural solutions, urban spaces). Skill-building in observation, and in recordings of physical environment and individual objects.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Urban Design Journal
info: Experiencing, analyzing, and recording urban landscape, its fabric, spatial elements, and individual components, through a journal.

subject: DIS
name: Arch:Scan Design/Architecture
info: Overview of Scandinavian design/architecture. Historical/current conditions of architecture, urban design, and planning from architectural, social, and political points of view.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Independent Study
info: Students meet weekly with faculty to prepare project.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Furniture Design Studio
info: Process of furniture making. Students develope/refine a concept, produce working drawings, and build a wood or steel model.

subject: DIS
name: Arch:Furn Design:Scandinavia
info: Introduction to furniture design in Scandinavia. Focuses on Denmark. Current/historical conditions of furniture. Design theories/methodologies.

subject: DIS
name: Arch: Digital Design Studio
info: Introduction to methods/theories relating to communication of cultural content in a digital environment. Students develop technical/graphic design abilities while exercising their communication skills.

subject: DIS
name: Arch:Digital Dsgn: Scandinavia
info: Aspects of history, theory, and practice of Scandinavian design. Philosophical, economic, and political trends that affect practice of design in a global perspective.

subject: DIS
name: Acct:Mgmt Acct:Tools,Prspctvs
fullname: Management Accounting: New Control Tools and Perspectives
info: Management accounting as integral part of a company.s larger perspective.

subject: DIS
name: Acct:Mgmt Acct: Contrl Systems
info: Management information systems as set of interactive decision support and early-warning systems for strategic management.

subject: DIS
name: Fina:Int’l Finance: Europe
fullname: International Finance in a European Context
info: Exchange rate determination, inflation rates, interest rates. Managing exchange-rate risk. Financial/investment decisions made by multinational companies. Issues related to European Economic and Monetary Union.

subject: DIS
name: BGS: Business Environment: EU
info: European Union in terms of basic business-related functions, institutions, policies, issues, and implications  for international business operations/competitiveness. Required study tours.

subject: DIS
name: BGS:Business w Russia & E Euro
fullname: Economies in Transition: Doing Business With Russia and Eastern Europe
info: Efforts of Russia and Central/Eastern European countries to transform economies. Opportunities for Western firms in marketization/reconstruction, trade, joint ventures, and investments.

subject: DIS
name: BGS:Environ Business Strategy
info: "Green management" experience. Action of advanced European companies in face of international environmental regulation, EU opportunities/instruments for industry, and management theory.

subject: DIS
name: BGS: EU Seminar
info: Students, based on knowledge gained in fall semester European Union course, study particular business-oriented aspects of EU in depth and present their findings in major report. Independent research in Denmark and in Brussels, Belgium.

subject: DIS
name: Mkgt:Management Field Project
info: Student groups act as management consultants and prepare industry analysis and marketing plan for real companies.

subject: DIS
name: Mgmt:Eur Globl Bus Strategy
info: Strategic response of European business managers to recent international economic developments.

subject: DIS
name: Mgmt: HR Mgmt in Europe
info: Analysis/interpretation of the way human resources are dealt with in various European countries.

subject: DIS
name: BGS: Business Environment: EU
info: European Union in terms of basic business-related functions, institutions, policies, issues, and implications for international business operations and competitiveness. Includes required study tours.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Marine Research Project
info: Research project with practical field components. Students use scientific libraries of various research institutions, engage in discussions/seminars with leading Danish/German scientists, and conduct experiments on research ship and at marine biological laboratory.

subject: DIS
name: Ecol & Human Impact: N Baltic
fullname: Ecology and Human Impact in the North and Baltic Seas
info: Ecosystems of North/Baltic Seas. How natural/human activities threaten their integrity. Given in Copenhagen area, with study tour in northern/western Denmark.

subject: DIS
name: Biol: Marine Mammals
info: Ecology/physiology of marine fish, birds, and mammals. Factors controlling vertebrate distribution/abundance. Role of vertebrates in marine ecosystems. Ecological impact of habitat alteration, pollution, fishing, and hunting. Emphasizes North/Baltic Seas.

subject: DIS
name: Biol: Ecotoxicology
info: Introduction to fate/effects of toxic chemicals in ecological systems.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Ecotox Lab:Int¿l Tests
fullname: Intensive Ecotoxicology Laboratory: Introduction to International Tests and Assays
info: Hands-on experience of standard ecotoxicological test methods used internationally.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Biophysical Ecophysiology
info: Introduction to biophysics and biophysical chemistry as basis for biologist's understanding of physiological processest.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Element,Energy:Ecosystem
fullname: Element and Energy Cycling in Ecosystems
info: Major element cycles/processes that regulate flow/transformation of elements/energy in ecosystems.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Carbn:Forest,Fjord Ecosys
fullname: Intensive Field Course: Carbon Cycling in Danish Forest and Fjord Ecosystems
info: Students use/evaluate classic ecological techniques for measuring carbon flow/transformations in terrestrial/aquatic ecosystems on coast of Denmark.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Arctic/Iceland
fullname: Arctic Biology: Life Under Extreme Conditions
info: Field/classroom study of arctic environments in Iceland. Focuses on marine, extreme conditions, comparisons with other climates, and effects of biodiversity on evolution/geology.

subject: DIS
name: Biol:Marine Biol:Euro Coastal
fullname: Marine Biology of European Coastal Waters
info: Marine biology of Baltic/North Seas. Coastal waters, interactions between organisms and their environment, methods to investigate biological systems. Students conduct simple experiments during field trips in Denmark.

subject: DIS
name: Geo:Vlcno,Glacier,Tctnic:Iclnd
fullname: Volcanos, Glaciers, and Plate Tectonics: Geology of Iceland
info: Field/classroom study of arctic environments in Iceland. Focuses on Mid-Atlantic Ridge kinetics, volcanoes, glaciers, and biology.

name: European News Media
info: NA

subject: DIS
name: Religion in Crisis
info: Study abroad course

name: New Members of the EU
fullname: New Members of the European Union
